Cairo.description: Cairo, the 'City of a Thousand Minarets,' is a vibrant metropolis where ancient history and modern life collide. As the largest city in the Arab world, it buzzes with energy amidst Pharaonic, Coptic, and Islamic landmarks.

places.name: Khan el-Khalili
places.description: A bustling medieval bazaar dating back to 1382, where narrow alleyways overflow with spices, lanterns, jewelry, and traditional crafts. The air fills with scents of perfumes and the sounds of merchants bargaining.

places.name: Cairo Tower
places.description: Standing 187 meters tall, this iconic lotus-shaped tower offers panoramic 360-degree views of greater Cairo. A modernist landmark providing the best vantage point to appreciate the city's vast expanse.

places.name: Citadel of Saladin
places.description: A magnificent Islamic fortification overlooking Cairo from the Mokattam Hills. This medieval fortress served as Egypt's seat of government for nearly 700 years and houses stunning mosques and museums.

places.name: Al-Azhar Mosque
places.description: One of the oldest universities in the world, founded in 970 AD. This architectural masterpiece represents the epicenter of Islamic learning and features beautiful courtyards and prayer halls.

places.name: Mosque of Muhammad Ali
places.description: Known as the Alabaster Mosque, this Ottoman-era masterpiece dominates the Cairo skyline. Its twin minarets and massive dome create one of the most recognizable silhouettes in the city.

Giza.description: The gateway to ancient Egypt's most iconic monuments, where the desert plateau hosts the legendary Pyramids and Sphinx that have captivated travelers for millennia.

places.name: Great Pyramid of Giza
places.description: The sole surviving wonder of the ancient world, built as a tomb for Pharaoh Khufu around 2560 BC. This engineering marvel stood as the tallest man-made structure for over 3,800 years.

places.name: Grand Egyptian Museum of giza
places.description: The world's largest archaeological museum, housing over 100,000 artifacts including the complete Tutankhamun collection. A state-of-the-art facility showcasing Egypt's priceless heritage.

places.name: Great Sphinx of giza
places.description: The mythical creature with a lion's body and human head, carved from a single limestone outcrop. This enigmatic guardian of the Giza Plateau has watched over the pyramids for 4,500 years.

places.name: Solar Boat Museum of giza
places.description: Home to a perfectly reconstructed cedarwood boat buried near the Great Pyramid for Pharaoh Khufu's journey to the afterlife. An incredible preservation of ancient Egyptian maritime technology.

Luxor.description: Often called the world's greatest open-air museum, this city stands on the site of ancient Thebes, featuring the most spectacular concentration of Pharaonic monuments in Egypt.

places.name: Karnak Temple
places.description: A vast temple complex that took over 2,000 years to build, featuring the magnificent Great Hypostyle Hall with 134 massive columns. The largest religious building ever constructed.

places.name: Valley of the Kings
places.description: The burial ground of pharaohs and powerful nobles for nearly 500 years, containing 63 magnificent tombs including Tutankhamun's famous discovery in 1922.

places.name: Luxor Temple
places.description: A majestic temple complex on the east bank of the Nile, famously connected to Karnak by the Avenue of Sphinxes. Particularly stunning when illuminated at night.

places.name: Hatshepsut Temple
places.description: A stunning terraced mortuary temple built into limestone cliffs, dedicated to Queen Hatshepsut - one of Egypt's most successful female pharaohs.

Aswan.description: A tranquil Nile-side city known for its beautiful islands, Nubian culture, and spectacular sunsets. The gateway to monumental temples and the engineering marvel of the High Dam.

places.name: Abu Simbel
places.description: The magnificent rock-cut temples of Ramses II, relocated to save them from Lake Nasser's rising waters. Famous for the sun illuminating the inner sanctuary twice yearly.

places.name: Philae Temple
places.description: The beautiful island temple dedicated to goddess Isis, featuring exquisite Ptolemaic architecture. Rescued and relocated after the Aswan Dam's construction.

places.name: Aswan High Dam
places.description: An engineering masterpiece that created Lake Nasser and transformed Egypt's agriculture. One of the largest embankment dams in the world.

places.name: Nubian Village
places.description: Vibrant communities along the Nile banks known for colorful houses, rich traditions, and warm hospitality. A living testament to Nubian culture and heritage.

Alexandria.description: The Mediterranean jewel founded by Alexander the Great, once home to the legendary Library and Lighthouse. A city where Greco-Roman history meets coastal charm.

places.name: Bibliotheca Alexandrina
places.description: A stunning modern revival of the ancient Library of Alexandria, featuring innovative architecture and housing millions of books in a magnificent cultural center.

places.name: Qaitbay Citadel
places.description: A 15th-century defensive fortress built on the exact site of the ancient Lighthouse of Alexandria, offering panoramic Mediterranean views from its ramparts.

places.name: Montaza Palace
places.description: A beautiful royal palace complex with lush gardens stretching along the Mediterranean coast. The perfect blend of Ottoman and Florentine architectural styles.

places.name: Pompey's Pillar
places.description: A massive 25-meter red granite column rising from ancient ruins, representing one of the largest monolithic columns ever erected in the ancient world.

Sharm El Sheikh.description: Egypt's premier Red Sea resort, famous for crystal-clear waters, vibrant coral reefs, and year-round sunshine. A paradise for divers and beach lovers alike.

places.name: Ras Mohammed National Park
places.description: World-renowned marine protected area at the southern tip of Sinai, offering some of the planet's most spectacular coral reefs and diverse marine life.

places.name: Naama Bay
places.description: The heart of Sharm's tourism, featuring a beautiful sandy beach, luxury resorts, and vibrant nightlife. The perfect base for Red Sea adventures.

Hurghada.description: A bustling Red Sea resort town transformed from fishing village to diving mecca, offering endless beaches, water sports, and access to pristine marine ecosystems.

places.name: Giftun Island
places.description: A protected natural paradise offering white sand beaches and exceptional snorkeling opportunities in the clear Red Sea waters just offshore from Hurghada.

places.name: Hurghada Marina
places.description: A modern waterfront development with luxury yachts, restaurants, and shops. The perfect place for evening strolls and watching spectacular sunsets.

places.name: El Gouna
places.description: An upscale resort town known as the 'Venice of the Red Sea' for its beautiful lagoons, upscale hotels, and sophisticated architecture amid desert landscapes.

Dubai.description: A city of superlatives where traditional souks stand in the shadow of record-breaking skyscrapers. A global hub known for luxury shopping, innovative architecture, and ambitious projects.

places.name: Burj Khalifa
places.description: The world's tallest building at 828 meters, featuring an observation deck on the 148th floor with breathtaking views of Dubai's dramatic skyline and desert beyond.

places.name: The Dubai Mall
places.description: One of the world's largest shopping destinations with over 1,200 stores, an aquarium, ice rink, and direct access to the Burj Khalifa and Dubai Fountain.

Abu Dhabi.description: The sophisticated capital of the UAE, blending modern architecture with cultural institutions on a network of natural islands in the Arabian Gulf.

places.name: Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque
places.description: A breathtaking architectural masterpiece capable of holding 40,000 worshippers, featuring 82 domes, 1,000 columns, and the world's largest hand-knotted carpet.

places.name: Louvre Abu Dhabi
places.description: An architectural marvel housing art and artifacts from around the world under a stunning perforated dome that creates a 'rain of light' effect.

Riyadh.description: The modern capital rising dramatically from the desert, where gleaming skyscrapers stand alongside historic mud-brick palaces in the heart of the Arabian Peninsula.

places.name: Kingdom Centre
places.description: An iconic 99-story skyscraper with a unique sky bridge offering panoramic city views, symbolizing Riyadh's transformation into a modern metropolis.

places.name: Al-Masmak Fortress
places.description: A clay and mud-brick fort celebrating the birthplace of modern Saudi Arabia, where the recapture of Riyadh in 1902 marked the beginning of unification.

Jeddah.description: The gateway to Mecca and a historic port city on the Red Sea, known for its coral architecture, vibrant souks, and the world's tallest fountain.

places.name: King Fahd's Fountain
places.description: The world's tallest fountain, shooting seawater 312 meters into the air - visible throughout much of Jeddah and particularly spectacular when illuminated at night.

places.name: Al-Balad
places.description: The historic heart of Jeddah featuring coral houses with ornate wooden balconies, traditional souks, and narrow alleyways that whisper tales of ancient trade routes.

Petra.description: The legendary 'Rose-Red City' carved directly into vibrant sandstone cliffs, lost to the Western world for centuries and rediscovered as one of the New Seven Wonders.

places.name: Al-Khazneh (The Treasury)
places.description: Petra's most magnificent facade, intricately carved into pink sandstone and made famous by Indiana Jones. The stunning first glimpse for visitors entering through the Siq.

places.name: The Monastery (Ad-Deir)
places.description: An enormous rock-cut monument even larger than the Treasury, reached by climbing 800 steps and offering breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains.

Amman.description: Jordan's modern capital built on seven hills, where ancient Roman ruins blend seamlessly with bustling markets and contemporary art galleries in a city of contrasts.

places.name: Amman Citadel
places.description: A historical site overlooking downtown Amman, featuring Roman, Byzantine, and Umayyad ruins including the Temple of Hercules and offering panoramic city views.

places.name: Roman Theatre
places.description: A beautifully preserved 2nd-century Roman theatre carved into the hillside, capable of seating 6,000 spectators and still used for cultural performances today.

Paris.description: The 'City of Light' and global capital of art, fashion, and romance, where iconic landmarks, world-class museums, and charming cafes create an unforgettable urban experience.

places.name: Eiffel Tower
places.description: The iron lattice tower that has become the universal symbol of Paris, offering stunning city views from its platforms and sparkling with thousands of lights every evening.

places.name: Louvre Museum
places.description: The world's largest art museum housed in a former royal palace, home to masterpieces including the Mona Lisa, Venus de Milo, and thousands of other artistic treasures.

Marseille.description: France's oldest city and vibrant Mediterranean port, where diverse cultures mix amid historic neighborhoods, calanques, and the bustling Vieux-Port.

places.name: Basilique Notre-Dame de la Garde
places.description: Marseille's iconic basilica perched on the city's highest point, offering spectacular harbor views and recognized by its golden statue of the Virgin Mary.

places.name: Vieux-Port
places.description: The historic heart of Marseille for over 2,600 years, where fishing boats still dock daily and waterfront cafes buzz with activity amid the Mediterranean atmosphere.

Rome.description: The Eternal City where ancient history lives alongside modern life, with spectacular ruins, Baroque fountains, and vibrant piazzas around every corner.

places.name: Colosseum
places.description: The iconic Roman amphitheater that hosted gladiatorial contests and public spectacles, standing as a magnificent symbol of Imperial Rome's architectural prowess.

places.name: Trevi Fountain
places.description: The largest Baroque fountain in Rome, famous for its dramatic sculpture of Oceanus and the tradition of tossing coins over your shoulder to ensure a return to Rome.

Venice.description: The magical floating city built on 118 islands, where canals replace streets, gondolas glide by historic palaces, and romance fills the air in this unique UNESCO treasure.

places.name: St. Mark's Square
places.description: Venice's principal public square surrounded by iconic landmarks including St. Mark's Basilica and the Campanile, often called 'the drawing room of Europe.

places.name: Grand Canal
places.description: The main waterway winding through Venice in an S-shape, lined with magnificent palaces and churches that showcase the city's architectural evolution over centuries.

New York City.description: The city that never sleeps, a global hub of finance, culture, and innovation where iconic landmarks, world-class museums, and diverse neighborhoods create endless energy.

places.name: Statue of Liberty
places.description: The universal symbol of freedom and democracy, gifted by France in 1886, standing proudly in New York Harbor as a welcoming sight to millions of immigrants.

places.name: Central Park
places.description: An urban oasis in the heart of Manhattan featuring 843 acres of lawns, lakes, and woodlands. The most visited urban park in the United States.

Los Angeles.description: The entertainment capital of the world, where Hollywood glamour meets beach culture in a sprawling metropolis of creative energy and year-round sunshine.

places.name: Hollywood Sign
places.description: The iconic white letters perched on Mount Lee, representing the global entertainment industry and offering one of the most photographed views in Los Angeles.

places.name: Santa Monica Pier
places.description: A classic California beach pier featuring an amusement park, aquarium, and historic carousel. The perfect place to experience LA's famous beach culture.

London.description: A world capital blending ancient history with cutting-edge modernity, where royal palaces stand alongside innovative architecture in this vibrant, multicultural metropolis.

places.name: Big Ben
places.description: The nickname for the Great Bell of the clock at the north end of the Palace of Westminster, though commonly referring to the entire clock tower - an icon of British democracy.

places.name: Tower Bridge
places.description: The magnificent Victorian bascule and suspension bridge over the River Thames, often mistaken for London Bridge and featuring high-level walkways with panoramic views.

Edinburgh.description: Scotland's majestic capital built around an ancient volcanic rock, where medieval Old Town and Georgian New Town create one of Europe's most beautiful cityscapes.

places.name: Edinburgh Castle
places.description: An imposing fortress dominating the city skyline from Castle Rock, housing the Scottish Crown Jewels and providing breathtaking views of Edinburgh.

places.name: Royal Mile
places.description: The historic thoroughfare connecting Edinburgh Castle to Holyrood Palace, lined with medieval buildings, shops, pubs, and significant historical sites.

Tokyo.description: A dazzling metropolis where ultra-modern skyscrapers stand beside ancient temples in the world's most populous metropolitan area, offering endless discovery.

places.name: Shibuya Crossing
places.description: The world's busiest pedestrian crossing where thousands of people cross simultaneously from multiple directions, creating an organized chaos that symbolizes modern Tokyo.

places.name: Senso-ji Temple
places.description: Tokyo's oldest temple, dating back to 645 AD, featuring a magnificent five-story pagoda and the bustling Nakamise shopping street leading to the main hall.

Kyoto.description: Japan's cultural heart with over 2,000 temples and shrines, where geisha still walk historic streets and traditional arts flourish amid beautiful gardens and tea houses.

places.name: Fushimi Inari Shrine
places.description: Famous for its thousands of vibrant red torii gates forming paths up the sacred Mount Inari, dedicated to the Shinto god of rice and business.

places.name: Kinkaku-ji (Golden Pavilion)
places.description: A Zen temple completely covered in gold leaf, reflected perfectly in the mirror pond surrounding it - one of Japan's most photographed sights.

Barcelona.description: The cosmopolitan capital of Catalonia, famous for Gaudi's architectural masterpieces, vibrant street life, and beautiful Mediterranean beaches in a city of creative energy.

places.name: Sagrada Famlia
places.description: Antoni Gaudi's magnificent basilica, under construction since 1882 and featuring extraordinary organic architecture that blends Gothic and Art Nouveau forms.

places.name: Park Gell
places.description: A magical public park designed by Gaudi, featuring colorful mosaics, unusual structures, and panoramic views of Barcelona from its famous serpentine bench.

Madrid.description: Spain's vibrant capital in the heart of the country, known for elegant boulevards, world-class art museums, and lively plazas that buzz with energy day and night.

places.name: Prado Museum
places.description: One of the world's greatest art museums, housing masterpieces by Spanish masters including Velzquez, Goya, and El Greco in a magnificent neoclassical building.

places.name: Royal Palace of Madrid
places.description: The official residence of the Spanish royal family and the largest functioning royal palace in Europe, featuring opulent rooms and priceless art collections.

Berlin.description: The capital and largest city of Germany, known for its exceptional range of landmarks, vibrant cultural scene, and way of life that is somehow all go yet relaxed. In fact, Berlin is best known for its striking contrasts. Historical buildings stand alongside modern architecture as the past and present intermingle.

places.name: Brandenburg Gate
places.description: An 18th-century neoclassical monument.

places.name: Museum Island
places.description: A magnificent complex of five internationally significant museums.

places.name: Reichstag Building
places.description: A historic edifice in Berlin that houses the Bundestag, the lower house of Germany's parliament.

Munich.description: The capital of Bavaria and the third-largest city in Germany. Munich is a fun-loving city known for its seasonal festivals (especially Oktoberfest), rich cultural calendar, and beer halls, along with a vibrant arts scene and museums.

places.name: Marienplatz
places.description: A central square in the city centre of Munich.

places.name: BMW Museum
places.description: An automobile museum of BMW history.

places.name: English Garden
places.description: A large public park in the centre of Munich, stretching from the city centre to the northeastern city limits.

Hamburg.description: A major port city in northern Germany, connected to the North Sea by the Elbe River. It's crossed by hundreds of canals, and also contains large areas of parkland.

places.name: Miniatur Wunderland
places.description: The world's largest model railway system, and a major tourist attraction in Hamburg.

places.name: Elbphilharmonie
places.description: A concert hall in the HafenCity quarter of Hamburg, located on the Elbe River.

Beijing.description: The sprawling capital of China, Beijing has a history stretching back 3 millennia. It is known as much for its modern architecture as its ancient sites such as the grand Forbidden City complex and the imperial palace during the Ming and Qing dynasties.

places.name: Great Wall of China
places.description: A series of fortifications built across the historical northern borders.

places.name: Summer Palace
places.description: A vast ensemble of lakes, gardens and palaces.

places.name: Forbidden City
places.description: A palace complex in central Beijing that served as the home of emperors and their households.

Shanghai.description: China's biggest city and a global financial hub. Its heart is the Bund, a famed waterfront promenade lined with colonial-era buildings. Across the Huangpu River rises the Pudong districts futuristic skyline, including the 632m Shanghai Tower.

places.name: The Bund
places.description: A waterfront area offering spectacular views of the Pudong skyline.

places.name: Yu Garden
places.description: An extensive Chinese garden located beside the City God Temple.

places.name: Shanghai Tower
places.description: A 128-story megatall skyscraper in Lujiazui, Pudong, Shanghai.

Xi'an.description: The capital of Shaanxi Province, and one of the oldest cities in China, known as the starting point of the Silk Road and home to the Terracotta Army.

places.name: Terracotta Army
places.description: A collection of terracotta sculptures depicting the armies of Qin Shi Huang, the first Emperor of China.

places.name: Xi'an City Wall
places.description: The most complete city wall that has survived in China, as well being one of the largest ancient military defensive systems in the world.

Sydney.description: Capital of New South Wales and one of Australia's largest cities, best known for its harbourfront Sydney Opera House, with a distinctive sail-like design. Massive Darling Harbour and the smaller Circular Quay port are hubs of waterside life.

places.name: Sydney Opera House
places.description: A multi-venue performing arts centre famous for its shell-like design.

places.name: Darling Harbour
places.description: A harbour adjacent to the city centre of Sydney, known for recreation and dining.

places.name: Sydney Harbour Bridge
places.description: A heritage-listed steel through arch bridge across Sydney Harbour.

Queensland.description: An Australian state covering the continent's northeast, with a coastline stretching nearly 7,000km. Its offshore Great Barrier Reef, the world's largest coral reef system, hosts thousands of marine species.

places.name: Great Barrier Reef
places.description: The world's largest coral reef system.

places.name: Daintree Rainforest
places.description: A tropical rainforest on the north east coast of Queensland, the oldest in the world.

places.name: Whitehaven Beach
places.description: A beach on Whitsunday Island, known for its crystal clear turquoise water and pristine silica sand.

Melbourne.description: The coastal capital of the southeastern Australian state of Victoria. At the city's centre is the modern Federation Square development, with plazas, bars, and restaurants by the Yarra River.

places.name: Federation Square
places.description: A venue for arts, culture and public events on the edge of the Melbourne central business district.

places.name: Royal Botanic Gardens
places.description: A major botanical garden located near the centre of Melbourne.

Rio de Janeiro.description: A huge seaside city in Brazil, famed for its Copacabana and Ipanema beaches, 38m Christ the Redeemer statue atop Mount Corcovado and for Sugarloaf Mountain, a granite peak with cable cars to its summit.

places.name: Christ the Redeemer
places.description: An Art Deco statue of Jesus Christ.

places.name: Selarn Steps
places.description: A set of world-famous steps covered in colorful tiles.

Foz do Iguacu.description: A city in the Brazilian state of Paran, serving as the main base for visiting the famed Iguazu Falls, one of the world's largest waterfalls, which sits on the border with Argentina.

places.name: Iguazu Falls
places.description: The largest waterfall system in the world.

places.name: Bird Park
places.description: A privately owned zoological park, located near the Iguazu Falls.

places.name: Itaipu Dam
places.description: A hydroelectric dam on the Paran River located on the border between Brazil and Paraguay.

Sao Paulo.description: A vibrant financial center and the world's most populous Portuguese-speaking city. It is known for its architecture, gastronomy, and cultural institutions.

places.name: Ibirapuera Park
places.description: A major urban park in So Paulo, and one of South America's largest city parks.

places.name: Paulista Avenue
places.description: One of the most important avenues in So Paulo, known for its financial institutions, cultural sites, and shopping.

Toronto.description: The capital of the province of Ontario, is a major Canadian city along Lake Ontarios northwestern shore. It's a dynamic metropolis with a core of soaring skyscrapers, all dwarfed by the iconic, free-standing CN Tower.

places.name: CN Tower
places.description: A communications and observation tower.

places.name: Distillery District
places.description: A commercial and residential district containing numerous cafs, restaurants, and shops.

places.name: Royal Ontario Museum
places.description: A museum of art, world culture and natural history in Toronto.

Banff.description: A resort town in the province of Alberta, located within Banff National Park. The peaks of Mt. Rundle and Mt. Cascade, part of the Rocky Mountains, dominate its skyline.

places.name: Lake Louise
places.description: A glacial lake within Banff National Park.

places.name: Banff Gondola
places.description: A cable car offering sweeping views of the six mountain ranges.

places.name: Moraine Lake
places.description: A glacially fed lake in Banff National Park, situated in the Valley of the Ten Peaks.

Vancouver.description: A bustling west coast seaport in British Columbia, is among Canadas densest, most ethnically diverse cities. A popular filming location, its surrounded by mountains, and also has thriving art, theatre and music scenes.

places.name: Stanley Park
places.description: A 405-hectare public park that borders the downtown of Vancouver and is mostly surrounded by waters of Burrard Inlet and English Bay.

places.name: Capilano Suspension Bridge
places.description: A simple suspension bridge crossing the Capilano River in the District of North Vancouver.

Istanbul.description: A major city in Turkey that straddles Europe and Asia across the Bosphorus Strait. Its Old City reflects cultural influences of the many empires that once ruled here.

places.name: Hagia Sophia
places.description: A Late Antique place of worship in Istanbul.

places.name: Basilica Cistern
places.description: The largest of several hundred ancient cisterns that lie beneath the city of Istanbul.

places.name: Topkapi Palace
places.description: A large museum in the east of the Fatih district of Istanbul. In the 15th and 16th centuries it served as the main residence and administrative headquarters of the Ottoman sultans.

Cappadocia.description: A semi-arid region in central Turkey, is known for its distinctive 'fairy chimneys,' tall, cone-shaped rock formations clustered in Monks Valley, Greme and elsewhere.

places.name: Fairy Chimneys
places.description: Unique rock formations famous for hot air balloon rides.

places.name: Uchisar Castle
places.description: A rock-cut castle located at the highest point in Cappadocia.

places.name: Goreme Open Air Museum
places.description: A vast monastic complex composed of scores of refectory monasteries placed side-by-side, each with its own fantastic church.

Antalya.description: A Turkish resort city with a yacht-filled Old Harbor and beaches flanked by large hotels. It's a gateway to Turkey's southern Mediterranean region.

places.name: Hadrian's Gate
places.description: A triumphal arch built in the name of the Roman emperor Hadrian.

places.name: Duden Waterfalls
places.description: A group of waterfalls in the province of Antalya, Turkey.

Agra.description: A city on the banks of the Yamuna river in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh. It is a major tourist destination because of its many Mughal-era buildings, most notably the Taj Mahal.

places.name: Taj Mahal
places.description: An ivory-white marble mausoleum.

places.name: Mehtab Bagh
places.description: A charbagh complex located north of the Taj Mahal complex.

places.name: Agra Fort
places.description: A historical fort in the city of Agra. It was the main residence of the emperors of the Mughal Dynasty until 1638.

Jaipur.description: The capital of Indias Rajasthan state. It evokes the royal family that once ruled the region and that, in 1727, founded what is now called the Old City, or 'Pink City' for its trademark building color.

places.name: Hawa Mahal
places.description: The 'Palace of Winds', known for its intricate pink sandstone lattice windows.

places.name: City Palace
places.description: A palace complex in Jaipur, which includes the Chandra Mahal and Mubarak Mahal palaces.

places.name: Amber Palace
places.description: A fort located in Amer, Rajasthan, India. Amer is a town with an area of 4 square kilometres located 11 kilometres from Jaipur.

Delhi.description: Indias capital territory, is a massive metropolitan area in the countrys north. In Old Delhi, a neighborhood dating to the 1600s, stands the imposing Mughal-era Red Fort.

places.name: India Gate
places.description: A war memorial located astride the Rajpath in New Delhi.

places.name: Humayun's Tomb
places.description: The tomb of the Mughal Emperor Humayun in Delhi, India.

places.name: Qutub Minar
places.description: A minaret and victory tower that forms part of the Qutb complex, a UNESCO World Heritage Site in the Mehrauli area of New Delhi.

Bangkok.description: The capital of Thailand. It is known for its ornate shrines and vibrant street life. The boat-filled Chao Phraya River feeds its network of canals.

places.name: The Grand Palace
places.description: A complex of buildings that has been the official residence of the Kings of Siam.

places.name: Chatuchak Market
places.description: The largest market in Thailand.

places.name: Wat Arun
places.description: A Buddhist temple in Bangkok Yai district of Bangkok, Thailand, on the Thonburi west bank of the Chao Phraya River.

Phuket.description: A rainforested, mountainous island in the Andaman Sea, has some of Thailands most popular beaches, situated along the clear waters of the western shore.

places.name: Patong Beach
places.description: The main tourist resort on Phuket.

places.name: Old Phuket Town
places.description: A historic area with Sino-Portuguese architecture and colorful buildings.

places.name: Big Buddha
places.description: A seated Maravijaya Buddha statue in Phuket, Thailand.

Chiang Mai.description: A city in mountainous northern Thailand. Founded in 1296, it was capital of the independent Lanna Kingdom until 1558.

places.name: Wat Phra That Doi Suthep
places.description: A Theravada Buddhist temple in Chiang Mai Province, Thailand.

places.name: Chiang Mai Old City
places.description: The historic center of Chiang Mai, surrounded by ancient walls and moats, filled with temples and markets.

Moscow.description: The capital of Russia, located on the Moskva River in western Russia. It is the nation's cosmopolitan capital, featuring historic sites like the Kremlin and Red Square.

places.name: Red Square
places.description: A city square in Moscow separating the Kremlin from the historic merchant quarter.

places.name: St. Basil's Cathedral
places.description: A church in Red Square known for its colorful onion domes.

places.name: The Moscow Kremlin
places.description: A fortified complex in the center of Moscow, overlooking the Moskva River.

Saint Petersburg.description: A Russian port city on the Baltic Sea. It remains the cultural center of Russia, with venues like the Mariinsky Theatre hosting opera and ballet, and the State Russian Museum showcasing Russian art.

places.name: Hermitage Museum
places.description: One of the largest and oldest museums in the world.

places.name: Peterhof Palace
places.description: A series of palaces and gardens, often referred to as the 'Russian Versailles'.

places.name: Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood
places.imageSearch: Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood
places.description: A former Russian Orthodox church in Saint Petersburg, containing over 7500 square meters of mosaics.

Kazan.description: A city in southwest Russia, on the banks of the Volga and Kazanka rivers. The capital of the Republic of Tatarstan, it is a semi-autonomous region known for its unique culture.

places.name: Kazan Kremlin
places.description: A historic citadel that contains the main historic citadel of Tatarstan, situated in the city of Kazan.

places.name: Kul Sharif Mosque
places.description: One of the largest mosques in Russia, located in the Kazan Kremlin.

Cape Town.description: A port city on South Africas southwest coast, on a peninsula beneath the imposing Table Mountain. Slowly rotating cable cars climb to the mountains flat top, from which there are sweeping views of the city.

places.name: Table Mountain
places.description: A flat-topped mountain forming a prominent landmark.

places.name: Kirstenbosch Gardens
places.description: A famous botanical garden nestled at the eastern foot of Table Mountain.

places.name: Robben Island
places.description: An island in Table Bay, 6.9 km west of the coast of Bloubergstrand, Cape Town, South Africa, known for imprisoning Nelson Mandela.

Sibiu.description: A city in Transylvania, central Romania, known for its Germanic architecture in the Old Town, the legacy of 12th-century Saxon settlers. It was the European Capital of Culture in 2007.

places.name: Grand Square
places.description: The historic center of Sibiu.

places.name: ASTRA Museum
places.description: One of the largest open-air museums in Europe.

Bucharest.description: The capital and largest city of Romania, as well as its cultural, industrial, and financial center. It is located in the southeast of the country and is known for its wide, tree-lined boulevards and Belle poque buildings.

places.name: Palace of the Parliament
places.description: The heaviest building in the world.

places.name: Romanian Athenaeum
places.description: A concert hall in the center of Bucharest and a landmark of the city.

Athens.description: The capital of Greece and the heart of Ancient Greece, a powerful civilization and empire. The city is still dominated by 5th-century BC landmarks, including the Acropolis, a hilltop citadel topped with ancient buildings like the Parthenon.

places.name: Acropolis of Athens
places.description: An ancient citadel on a rocky outcrop.

places.name: Syntagma Square
places.description: The central square of Athens, located in front of the Old Royal Palace.

Santorini.description: One of the Cyclades islands in the Aegean Sea. It was devastated by a volcanic eruption in the 16th century BC, forever shaping its rugged landscape. The whitewashed, cubiform houses of its two principal towns, Fira and Oia, cling to cliffs above an underwater caldera.

places.name: Oia
places.description: A coastal town famous for its whitewashed houses.

places.name: Fira
places.description: The capital of Santorini, perched on the edge of the high caldera.

Buenos Aires.name: Recoleta Cemetery
Buenos Aires.description: A cemetery containing the graves of notable people, including Eva Pern.

Patagonia.name: Perito Moreno Glacier
Patagonia.description: A massive glacier in Los Glaciares National Park.

Patagonia.name: Mount Fitz Roy
Patagonia.description: A mountain located near El Chaltn, famous for hiking.

Zurich.name: Lake Zurich
Zurich.description: A lake offering swimming, boating and picnicking.

Zurich.name: Grossmnster
Zurich.description: A Romanesque-style Protestant church in Zurich.

Zermatt.name: Matterhorn
Zermatt.description: A mountain of the Alps, known for its distinct pyramid shape.

Zermatt.name: Gornergrat
Zermatt.description: A rocky ridge of the Pennine Alps, offering views of the Matterhorn.

Cusco.name: Machu Picchu
Cusco.description: A 15th-century Inca citadel set high in the Andes Mountains.

Cusco.name: Qorikancha
Cusco.description: The most important temple in the Inca Empire.

Lima.name: Miraflores
Lima.description: An upscale district known for its shopping and beaches.

Lima.name: Larco Museum
Lima.description: A privately owned museum of pre-Columbian art.

Marrakech.name: Jemaa el-Fnaa
Marrakech.description: A famous square and market place.

Chefchaouen.name: Medina
Chefchaouen.description: The old town famous for its blue-rinsed buildings.

Chefchaouen.name: Spanish Mosque
Chefchaouen.description: A mosque on a hill overlooking the blue city.

Lisbon.name: Praa do Comrcio
Lisbon.description: A large, harbour-facing plaza in Portugal's capital.

Sintra.name: Pena Palace
Sintra.description: A Romanticist castle that stands on the top of a hill.

Prague.name: Charles Bridge
Prague.description: A medieval stone arch bridge that crosses the Vltava river.

Prague.name: Old Town Hall (Prague)
Prague.imageSearch: Old Town Hall Prague Astronomical Clock
Prague.description: Famous for its medieval Astronomical Clock.

Budapest.name: Buda Castle
Budapest.description: The historical castle and palace complex of the Hungarian kings.

Dubrovnik.name: City Walls
Dubrovnik.description: A series of defensive stone walls surrounding the city.

Dubrovnik.name: Lovrijenac
Dubrovnik.description: A fortress and theater outside the western wall of the city.

Split.name: Diocletian's Palace
Split.description: An ancient palace built for the Roman emperor Diocletian.

Split.name: Marjan Hill
Split.description: A hill on the peninsula of the city of Split, covered in a dense pine forest.

Amsterdam.name: Rijksmuseum
Amsterdam.description: A Dutch national museum dedicated to arts and history.

Amsterdam.name: Jordaan
Amsterdam.description: A district famous for its beautiful houses, nice restaurants and original shops.

Brussels.name: Royal Palace
Brussels.description: The official palace of the King and Queen of the Belgians.

Bruges.name: Belfry of Bruges
Bruges.description: A medieval bell tower in the center of Bruges.

Bruges.name: Lake of Love
Bruges.description: A romantic park with a lake and swans.

Taipei.description: Taipei is the capital and a special municipality of Taiwan. Located in the northern part of the island, it is the political, economic, educational, and cultural center of Taiwan. It is a modern metropolis known for its lively street-food scene, night markets, and the bamboo-shaped Taipei 101 skyscraper.

places.name: Taipei 101
places.description: A landmark supertall skyscraper.

places.name: Elephant Mountain
places.description: A hiking trail offering the best views of Taipei 101.

Jiufen.description: Jiufen is a mountain area in the Ruifang District of New Taipei City, Taiwan. Once a prosperous gold mining town, it is now famous for its maze of narrow alleyways, tea houses, and stunning views of the Pacific Ocean. It is often associated with the atmosphere of the animated movie 'Spirited Away'.

places.name: Jiufen Old Street
places.description: A mountain area known for its maze of lanes and alleyways.

places.name: Golden Waterfall
places.description: A waterfall famous for its golden color due to heavy metal elements.

Ulaanbaatar.description: Ulaanbaatar is the capital and largest city of Mongolia. Located in the north-central part of the country, the city lies at an elevation of about 1,300 meters in a valley on the Tuul River. It is the cultural, industrial, and financial heart of the country, known for its unique blend of Soviet-era architecture, traditional yurts (gers), and Buddhist monasteries.

places.name: Gandan Monastery
places.description: A Tibetan-style Buddhist monastery.

places.name: Sukhbaatar Square
places.description: The central square of Mongolia's capital.

Kathmandu.description: Kathmandu is the capital and largest city of Nepal. It is located in the Kathmandu Valley, a large valley in the high plateaus in central Nepal. The city is the gateway to the Nepalese Himalayas and is home to seven UNESCO World Heritage Sites, showcasing a rich history of art, architecture, and culture.

places.name: Boudhanath Stupa
places.description: One of the largest spherical stupas in Nepal.

places.name: Durbar Square
places.description: The plaza in front of the old royal palace.

Islamabad.description: Islamabad is the capital city of Pakistan, and is administratively part of the Islamabad Capital Territory. Built as a planned city in the 1960s to replace Karachi as Pakistan's capital, Islamabad is noted for its high standards of living, safety, and abundant greenery, nestled against the Margalla Hills.

places.name: Faisal Mosque
places.description: The largest mosque in Pakistan.

places.name: Pakistan Monument
places.description: A national monument and heritage museum.

Colombo.description: Colombo is the commercial capital and largest city of Sri Lanka. It is a busy and vibrant place with a mixture of modern life, colonial buildings, and ruins. The city has a long history as a port on ancient east-west trade routes, ruled successively by the Portuguese, Dutch, and British.

places.name: Gangaramaya Temple
places.description: One of the most important Buddhist temples in Colombo.

places.name: Lotus Tower
places.description: A tower that is the tallest self-supported structure in South Asia.

Sigiriya.description: Sigiriya is an ancient rock fortress located in the northern Matale District near the town of Dambulla in the Central Province, Sri Lanka. It is a site of historical and archaeological significance that is dominated by a massive column of rock around 180 metres high, often referred to as the Eighth Wonder of the World.

places.name: Sigiriya Rock Fortress
places.description: An ancient rock fortress.

places.name: Pidurangala Rock
places.description: A massive rock formation offering views of Sigiriya.

Nairobi.description: Nairobi is the capital and largest city of Kenya. The name comes from the Maasai phrase Enkare Nyrobi, which translates to 'cool water'. It is one of the most prominent cities in Africa, both politically and financially, and is famous for being the only major city in the world with a game reserve strictly within its borders.

places.name: Nairobi National Park
places.description: A national park just 7km south of Nairobi.

places.name: Karen Blixen Museum
places.description: The former African home of the Danish author.

Masai Mara.description: The Maasai Mara National Reserve is a large game reserve in Narok, Kenya, contiguous with the Serengeti National Park in Tanzania. It is named in honor of the Maasai people, the ancestral inhabitants of the area. It is globally famous for its exceptional population of lions, leopards, and cheetahs, and the annual migration of zebra and wildebeest.

places.name: Masai Mara Reserve
places.description: A large game reserve in Narok.

places.name: Mara River
places.description: A river famous for the wildebeest migration crossing.

Zanzibar.description: Zanzibar is an insular semi-autonomous region of Tanzania. It is an archipelago in the Indian Ocean, consisting of many small islands and two large ones. The capital is Zanzibar City, known for its historic center, Stone Town, which is a World Heritage Site famous for its winding lanes and Swahili culture.

places.name: Stone Town
places.description: The old part of Zanzibar City.

places.name: Prison Island
places.description: An island famous for its giant tortoises.

Arusha.description: Arusha is a city in northeastern Tanzania and the capital of the Arusha Region. Located below Mount Meru on the eastern edge of the eastern branch of the Great Rift Valley, Arusha has a temperate climate and is close to many of Tanzania's greatest landscapes and national parks, making it the safari capital of the country.

places.name: Mount Kilimanjaro
places.description: The highest mountain in Africa.

places.name: Arusha National Park
places.description: A gem of varied ecosystems and spectacular views of Mt. Meru.

Kampala.description: Kampala is the capital and largest city of Uganda. The city is divided into five boroughs that oversee local planning: Kampala Central Division, Kawempe Division, Makindye Division, Nakawa Division, and Rubaga Division. It is a dynamic and engaging city with a rich history, known for its seven hills.

places.name: Kasubi Tombs
places.description: The site of the burial grounds for four kabakas.

places.name: Uganda Museum
places.description: A museum displaying Uganda's cultural heritage.

Kigali.description: Kigali is the capital and largest city of Rwanda. It is near the nation's geographic center in a region of rolling hills, with a series of valleys and ridges joined by steep slopes. The city is Rwanda's economic, cultural, and transport hub, known for its cleanliness and orderliness.

places.name: Kigali Genocide Memorial
places.description: Commemorates the 1994 Rwandan genocide.

places.name: Inema Art Center
places.description: A collective of Rwandan creative artists.

Addis Ababa.description: Addis Ababa is the capital and largest city of Ethiopia. It is where the African Union is headquartered and also hosts the headquarters of the United Nations Economic Commission for Africa. Lying at the foot of Mount Entoto, the city is a hub of Ethiopian culture and history.

places.name: National Museum
places.description: Houses the nation's artistic treasures.

places.name: Holy Trinity Cathedral
places.description: The highest ranking Orthodox cathedral in Addis Ababa.

Lalibela.description: Lalibela is a town in the Amhara Region of northern Ethiopia. It is famous for its monolithic rock-cut churches. The arrangement and names of the major buildings in Lalibela are widely accepted to be a symbolic representation of Jerusalem.

places.name: Rock-Hewn Churches
places.description: 11 medieval monolithic cave churches.

places.name: Church of St. George
places.description: The most famous and best preserved of the rock-hewn churches.

Tunis.description: Tunis is the capital and largest city of Tunisia. The greater metropolitan area of Tunis, often referred to as 'Grand Tunis', holds some 2.7 million people. Situated on a large Mediterranean Sea gulf (the Gulf of Tunis), behind the Lake of Tunis and the port of La Goulette, the city extends along the coastal plain and the hills that surround it.

places.name: Medina of Tunis
places.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site.

places.name: Bardo Museum
places.description: One of the most important museums in the Mediterranean region.

Carthage.description: Carthage was the capital city of the ancient Carthaginian civilization, on the eastern side of the Lake of Tunis in what is now Tunisia. It was one of the most important trading hubs of the Ancient Mediterranean and one of the most affluent cities of the classical world.

places.name: Carthage Ruins
places.description: The archaeological site of the ancient city of Carthage.

places.name: Byrsa Hill
places.description: The walled citadel of ancient Carthage.

Algiers.description: Algiers is the capital and largest city of Algeria. The city's northern part, the modern part, is built on the level ground by the seashore; the southern part, the ancient city of the Deys, climbs the steep hill behind the modern town and is crowned by the Casbah or citadel.

places.name: Casbah of Algiers
places.description: A unique medina type of city.

places.name: Notre Dame d'Afrique
places.description: A Roman Catholic basilica overlooking the Bay of Algiers.

Bali.description: Bali is a province of Indonesia and the westernmost of the Lesser Sunda Islands. It is the country's main tourist destination, renowned for its highly developed arts, including traditional and modern dance, sculpture, painting, leather, metalworking, and music.

places.name: Ubud Monkey Forest
places.description: A nature reserve and Hindu temple complex.

places.name: Tanah Lot
places.description: A rock formation home to the ancient Hindu pilgrimage temple.

Jakarta.description: Jakarta is the capital and largest city of Indonesia. Lying on the northwest coast of Java, the world's most populous island, Jakarta is the largest city in Southeast Asia and serves as the diplomatic capital of ASEAN.

places.name: National Monument
places.description: A tower in the center of Merdeka Square.

places.name: Istiqlal Mosque
places.description: The largest mosque in Southeast Asia.

Hanoi.description: Hanoi is the capital city of Vietnam. It covers an area of 3,358.6 km2. The second most populous city in Vietnam, it consists of 12 urban districts, one district-level town, and 17 rural districts. It is known for its centuries-old architecture and a rich culture with Southeast Asian, Chinese, and French influences.

places.name: Ha Long Bay
places.description: Known for its emerald waters and limestone islands.

places.name: Old Quarter
places.description: The historic soul of Hanoi.

Manila.description: Manila is the capital of the Philippines. It is a highly urbanized city and one of the most densely populated cities in the world. It was the first chartered city in the country and is known for its Spanish colonial architecture.

places.name: Intramuros
places.description: The historic walled area within the city.

places.name: Rizal Park
places.description: A historic urban park in the Philippines.

Boracay.description: Boracay is a small island in the Philippines. It is famous for its beaches and resorts. The island is administered by the Tourism Infrastructure and Enterprise Zone Authority and the provincial government of Aklan.

places.name: White Beach
places.description: Famous for its powdery white sand.

Kuala Lumpur.description: Kuala Lumpur is the capital city of Malaysia. It is the largest city in the country and one of the fastest growing metropolitan regions in Southeast Asia. It is the cultural, financial, and economic centre of Malaysia.

places.name: Petronas Towers
places.description: Twin skyscrapers that dominate the skyline.

places.name: Batu Caves
places.description: A limestone hill that has a series of caves and cave temples.

Singapore.description: Singapore is a sovereign island city-state in maritime Southeast Asia. It lies about one degree of latitude (137 kilometres or 85 miles) north of the equator. The country is known for its transition from third world to first world in a single generation, becoming a global financial center.

places.name: Marina Bay Sands
places.description: An integrated resort fronting Marina Bay.

places.name: Gardens by the Bay
places.imageSearch: Supertree Grove Gardens by the Bay
places.description: A nature park spanning 101 hectares.

Mal.description: Mal is the capital and most populous city in the Republic of Maldives. It is located at the southern edge of North Mal Atoll. The central island is heavily urbanized, with the built-up area taking up essentially its entire landmass.

places.name: Grand Friday Mosque
places.description: The biggest mosque in the Maldives.

places.name: Male Fish Market
places.description: The commercial heart of the island.

Santiago.description: Santiago is the capital and largest city of Chile as well as one of the largest cities in the Americas. It is the center of Chile's most densely populated region, the Santiago Metropolitan Region. The city is entirely located in the country's central valley.

places.name: Costanera Center
places.description: Includes the tallest building in South America.

places.name: San Cristobal Hill
places.description: A hill in northern Santiago with beautiful views.

Atacama.description: The Atacama Desert is a desert plateau in South America covering a 1,600 km strip of land on the Pacific coast, west of the Andes Mountains. It is the driest non-polar desert in the world, famous for its otherworldly landscapes.

places.name: Moon Valley
places.description: Stone and sand formations which look similar to the moon.

Bogota.description: Bogot is the capital and largest city of Colombia, administered as the Capital District. The city is located in the center of Colombia, on a high plateau known as the Bogot savanna. It is the political, economic, administrative, and industrial center of the country.

places.name: Monserrate
places.description: A mountain that dominates the city center.

Auckland.name: Sky Tower
Auckland.description: The tallest freestanding structure in the Southern Hemisphere.

Queenstown.name: Milford Sound
Queenstown.description: A fiord known for towering Mitre Peak.

Stockholm.name: Vasa Museum
Stockholm.description: Displays the only almost fully intact 17th-century ship.

Copenhagen.name: Tivoli Gardens
Copenhagen.description: A famous amusement park and pleasure garden.

Helsinki.name: Suomenlinna
Helsinki.description: An inhabited sea fortress built on six islands.

Vienna.name: Schnbrunn Palace
Vienna.description: The main summer residence of the Habsburg rulers.

Vienna.name: St. Stephen's Cathedral
Vienna.description: The mother church of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Vienna.

Hallstatt.name: Hallstatt Old Town
Hallstatt.description: A village known for its 16th-century Alpine houses.

Krakow.name: Main Market Square
Krakow.description: The main square of the Old Town of Krakw.

Krakow.name: Wawel Royal Castle
Krakow.description: A castle residency built at the behest of King Casimir III the Great.
